title: The graph of the derivative of a function

content.question: The graph of a function f is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of fâ€™, the derivative of f ?

choices.label: A graph plots an upward opening parabola that originates in the second quadrant, falls down through the origin to a minimum point in the fourth quadrant, and further rises through the positive x axis into the first quadrant.

A graph plots an upward opening parabola that originates in the second quadrant, falls down through the negative x axis to a minimum point on the negative y axis, and further rises through the positive x axis into the first quadrant.

A graph plots a wave shaped curve that originates at the top of the second quadrant, falls to a minimum point in the third quadrant, rises through the origin to a maximum point in the first quadrant, and further falls down into the fourth quadrant.

A graph plots a downward opening parabola that originates in the third quadrant, rises through the negative x axis to a maximum point on the positive y axis, and further falls through the positive x axis into the fourth quadrant.
A graph plots a downward opening parabola that originates in the third quadrant, rises to a maximum point on the negative y axis, and further falls into the fourth quadrant.

content.answer: A graph plots an upward opening parabola that originates in the second quadrant, falls down through the negative x axis to a minimum point on the negative y axis, and further rises through the positive x axis into the first quadrant.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
